intro: Pleiarina ichnostachya, commonly known as the slender spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
